solution_line_template: The mileage cost for the first apartment will be {miles_per_day_apt1}*{work_days_per_month}*{cost_per_mile} = $<<{miles_per_day_apt1}*{work_days_per_month}*{cost_per_mile}={mileage_cost_apt1}>>{mileage_cost_apt1}

This makes the total monthly cost of the first apartment {mileage_cost_apt1} + {rent_apt1} + {utilities_apt1} = $<<{mileage_cost_apt1}+{rent_apt1}+{utilities_apt1}={total_cost_apt1}>>{total_cost_apt1}

Similarly, the mileage cost for the second apartment will be {miles_per_day_apt2}*{work_days_per_month}*{cost_per_mile} = $<<{miles_per_day_apt2}*{work_days_per_month}*{cost_per_mile}={mileage_cost_apt2}>>{mileage_cost_apt2}
Thus, the total monthly cost of the second apartment is {mileage_cost_apt2} + {rent_apt2} + {utilities_apt2} = <<{mileage_cost_apt2}+{rent_apt2}+{utilities_apt2}={total_cost_apt2}>>{total_cost_apt2}
Therefore, the difference in total monthly costs is {total_cost_apt1} - {total_cost_apt2} = $<<{total_cost_apt1}-{total_cost_apt2}={difference}>>{difference}
